Column Comment.0: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row of data.Valid entries include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY, SEIS_PLAN,SEIS_WELL, SEIS_PROC_SET, SEIS_INTERP_SET or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.1: SEISMIC SET: A seismic set is a super type of various types of seismic collections.Valid types of seismic sets includeSEIS_LINE, SEIS_3D, SEIS_SEGMENT andSEIS_SURVEY.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVITY OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique identifier for an activity on a seismicset.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: ACTIVITY DURATION: the total clock duration of this activity, from start to finish. Maynot be the same as TOTAL TIME for activities that are not continuous.
Column Comment.6: AREA SIZE: The size of the area that is related to this activity, usually kept for billingpurposes or for calculating metrics.
Column Comment.8: CREW COMPANY BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for thecompany that runs this crew. Not all members of a crew may be employees, but maybe contractors or seconded to the crew by another company.
Column Comment.9: CREW IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the crew.
Column Comment.10: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.11: END DATE: The date that this activity ended or was completed.
Column Comment.12: END TIME: Clock time when the activity ended.
Column Comment.13: R TIMEZONE: a valid list of time zones. You can obtain a list of timezones fromwww.worldtimezone.com.
Column Comment.14: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.15: FIRST NLINE NUMBER: The number of the first nline in the seismic set.
Column Comment.16: FIRST SEISMIC POINT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the first seismic pointassociated with an activity.
Column Comment.17: FIRST XLINE NUMBER: The number of the first xline in the seismic set.
Column Comment.18: LAST NLINE NUMBER: The number of the last nline in the seismic set.
Column Comment.19: SEISMIC POINT ID: Unique identifier for each seismic point
Column Comment.20: LAST XLINE NUMBER: The number of the last xline in the seismic set.
Column Comment.21: LINE LENGTH: the length of the linear segment that is related to an activity, usuallycalcuated and stored for billing or metrics calculation.
Column Comment.23: OWNER BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the businessassociate who owns this activity.
Column Comment.24: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.25: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.26: SEISMIC ACTIVITY CLASS: A class or group of activity types related to seismicdata. Examples include planning activities, acquisition activities, processing activities,records management activities etc
Column Comment.27: SEISMIC ACTIVITY: A Kind of activity related to seismic data. Activites are qualifiedby the class of activity (R SEIS ACTIVITY CLASS) they are engaged in, such asplanning activities, acquisition activities, processing activities, records managementactivities etc.
Column Comment.28: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.29: START DATE: The date that this activity was started.
Column Comment.30: START TIME: The clock time when this activity was started.
Column Comment.31: R TIMEZONE: a valid list of time zones. You can obtain a list of timezones fromwww.worldtimezone.com.
Column Comment.32: TOTAL TIME ELAPSED: the total time for this event or status. This may differ fromthe DURATION or elapsed time (clock time from start to finish) in that an event maynot occupy all of a period.
Column Comment.34: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.35: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.36: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.37: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.38: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.39: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.40: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
